CONJUGATES: yellower | yellowest (adj.) | yellows (n. plural) | yellowed | yellowing (v.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English geolu, geolwe, from Proto-Germanic *gelwaz, from Proto-Indo-European *ǵʰelH- 'to shine, gleam; yellow, green'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having the color of ripe lemons or gold; the color between green and orange in the spectrum.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 具有成熟柠檬或黄金的颜色；光谱中介于绿色和橙色之间的颜色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 胆怯的，懦弱的；容易被吓到的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He turned yellow and ran away when confronted with danger.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 面对危险，他变得胆怯并逃跑了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我最喜欢的颜色是黄色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: intransitive verb: a verb that does not require a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old pages of the book had yellowed with age.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这本书的旧书页已经因为年代久远而发黄了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A type of journalism that presents little or no legitimate well-researched news and instead uses eye-catching headlines to sell more newspapers.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 指一种新闻报道方式，很少提供或不提供合法、深入研究的新闻，而是使用耸人听闻的标题来销售报纸。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Yellow journalism was prevalent in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 黄色新闻在19世纪末20世纪初盛行。

REGISTER: Generally informal when describing a person as cowardly, otherwise neutral for color definitions and formal for 'yellow journalism'.
